bibl.title: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, May 12, 1907

div1.p: The Kissingers thank Kelly for his continued support.

div1.head: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, May 12, 1907
div1.opener:
V
May 12/07
Howard A. Kelly
Dear Kind friend
div1.p:
you will pleas' excuse Mr Kissinger
and I for neglecting to write to
you thanking you for your Photo
we recieved it some 10. ten days ago
and was greatly pleased to get It.
but we were in the midst of our
House cleaning and just neglected It
Mr. Kissinger Isn't any better if there is
a change it is that he is weaker.
he gets so despondent at times that
I feel greatly worried over him.
the Dr dosent want him to work at
all but he feels he must help and
It tires him so. we both have worked
beyond our strength this winter but
2
summer is here and I hope things
will be more cheerful
did you receive a sufficient amount
of Photos. We sent 5 of then but
were not sure wheather you wanted 3 sets
or 3 Photos.
Will close by thanking you again for
your photo and kindness.
div1.closer:
Mr. and Mrs. John R Kissinger 606 E Keasey St
South Bend
Indiana
